activityName: Sunflower oil, at oil mill {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
Economic allocation:
Price for 1 kg Sunflower oil = 0.72 US $/pound = 1.58 $/kg; 
Price for 1 kg Sunflower oil cake = 0.11 US $/pound = 0.24 $/kg.  Price ratio of cake : oil = 0.15
Sunflower lecithin assumed to have the same value as soybean lecithin: 600 euro/kg = 0.700 $/kg (source: based on soybean lecithin in the Fediol report)

activityName: Agaricus bisporus mushroom, fresh, at plant {NL} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
Mushroom production in the Netherlands. Mainly based on Leiva 2015a data, adapted to NL for the electricity and water. 
This dataset includes the compost substrate input inoculated with the mycellium, the growing chambers disinfection, soil covering, the chambers temperature and humidity control (energy consumption) and the growing process. The direct emissions from peat are included. 
The infrastructure are excluded as well as the mushroom packaging.

For all fish data are based on expert say.
The share of domestic production is 40%, while the remainder is split equitably between EU import (refrigerated truck transport per 1,000 km) and non-EU import (refrigerated boat transport per 10,000 km)

food.explain:
Cet ICV correspond à la production de l'huile de colza, de la culture jusqu'aux portes de l'usine. La trituration et le raffinage sont représentatifs de la production en France pour un usage alimentaire. Le transport des graines de colza est inclus mais le transport aval de l'huile de colza n'est pas inclus dans cet ICV. 
Cet ICV se retrouve dans de nombreux autres produits Agribalyse contenant de l'huile de colza. 
Selon le mix de consommation français de l'huile de colza, l'origine par défaut devrait être Europe. 
La densité de l'huile de colza est de 0,915. 
Comme le précise la méthodologie AGRIBALYSE, il n'y a pas de transport frigorifique pour les huiles végétales.

Remarque : l'ICV ""Rapeseed oil, at oil mill {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U"" correspond à la donnée huile de colza de Agribalyse 3.0. Cette donnée n'est pas spécifique à la production française. Cet ICV n'est pas utilisé dans les autres produits Agribalyse.

activityName: Extra Virgin Olive Oil, at plant {ES} U
comment:
This dataset represents the virgin oil extraction in Spain from olive produced in Spain. 

Included processes: This process includes the production of olive in Spain, cleaning and rinsing of harvest olives and Extra Virgin Olive Oil extraction from two phases process. 
Remark : Inventory refers to the production of 1kg of Extra Virgin Olive Oil and 4,46 kg of pomace from 5,83 kg of harvest olives. System boundary is at Spain mill. Electricity, water consumption and extraction Yield_ are based on default value proposed by PEFCR for Olive rules (3rd Draft, 2016). 
Economic Allocation is applied between Extra Virgin Olive Oil and pomace, based on price proposed in PEFCR : Extra Virgin Olive Oil : 1,88/kg and Pomace : 0,01/kg
Geography: Extra Virgin Olive Oil production in Spain
Technology: Extra Virgin Olive Oil extraction two phases, representative of extraction process in Spain. 
Time period: Data from PEFCR Olive Oil, 2016,

food.explain:
Cet ICV correspond à la production de l'huile d'olive extra vierge, de la culture jusqu'aux portes de l'usine. La trituration est représentative de la production en Espagne. Cet ICV est l'ICV majoritaire du mix de consommation d'huile d'olive en France. Le transport aval de l'huile d'olive n'est pas inclus dans cet ICV.
Selon le mix de consommation français de l'huile d'olive, l'origine par défaut devrait être Europe ou Maghreb. 
La densité de l'huile d'olive est de 0,914. 
Comme le précise la méthodologie AGRIBALYSE, il n'y a pas de transport frigorifique pour les huiles végétales.

food.explain:
Cet ICV correspond à la production de l'huile de tournesol, de la culture jusqu'aux portes de l'usine. Un mix d'importation des graines de tournesol est considéré (origines France,  Roumanie, Bulgarie, Argentine et transport inclus). La trituration et le raffinage sont représentatifs de la production en France. Cet ICV est l'ICV majoritaire du mix de consommation d'huile de tournesol en France. Le transport aval de l'huile de tournesol n'est pas inclus dans cet ICV. 
Cet ICV se retrouve dans de nombreux autres produits Agribalyse contenant de l'huile de tournesol. 
Selon le mix de consommation français de l'huile de tournesol, l'origine par défaut devrait être Europe. 
La densité de l'huile de tournesol est de 0,920. 
Comme le précise la méthodologie AGRIBALYSE, il n'y a pas de transport frigorifique pour les huiles végétales.

Remarque : l'ICV ""Sunflower oil, at oil mill {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U"" correspond à la donnée huile de tournesol de Agribalyse 3.0. Cette donnée n'est pas spécifique à la  production française. Cet ICV n'est pas utilisé dans les autres produits Agribalyse.

melamine urea formaldehyde adhesive//[GLO] market for melamine urea formaldehyde adhesive
Canning fruits or vegetables, industrial, 1kg of canned product {FR} U
comment:
"Functional Unit
To obtain 1kg of canned vegetable or fruit. 
An input of 0,626kg of food is required. Added packaging should account for the 1% loss.

Boundaries
From peeled fruit or vegetable to canned product: food slicing, can filling (38% water) and sterilization. 1% loss rate is applied at the end. The washing of fruit and vegetable prior to canning and the production and EoL of packaging is out of scope (because already considered upstream or downstream in Agribalyse v3.0).
Contrary to canned fruits, canned vegetables go through a blanching step prior to canning: Canned vegetables generally require more severe processing than do fruits because the vegetables have much lower acidity and contain more heat-resistant soil organisms. Many vegetables also require more cooking than fruits to develop their most desirable flavor and texture.
we considered 50% of canned vegetables (with a blanching step) and 50% of canned fruits (without any blanching) to model the canning process."

activityName: Soybean oil, refined, at plant {FR} U
comment:
Data are representative of refined soybean oil production from soybean seeds. 5,4k g of soybean seeds are needed to produce 1 kg of refined soybean oil and 4,24 kg of soybean oil cake. 
Data source : industrial data, representative for crushing and refining of soybean oil in Europe. Data from FEDIOL, 2013. Life cycle assessment of EU Oilseed Crushing and Vegetable oil refining. Final report 59 pages
Economic Allocation
Economic value from FEDIOL report : 0,809/kg of refined soybean oil, 0,297/kg of soybean oil meal, 0,6/kg of soybean lecithin, 0,35/kg of soybean soap stock

The consumption mix of soybean oil in France was determined with importation and production data from FAOSTAT (average 2015-2019). The average conusmption mix (2015-2019) was : France, 70%, Spain, 12%, others origins (mainly UE countries)  : 18%. Only French  origin are considered in this datasets, representing 70% of market mix

activityName: Linseed oil, refined, at oil mill {FR} U
comment:
Dataset of the production of refined linseed oil in France. It includes crushing of linseed grain, representative of French consumption mix, and refining of crude oil. 
3,36 kg of linseed are needed for the production of 1kg of refined Linseed oil and Linseed oil cake.
Economic allocation is made between oil, cake and refining co-products
Price for 1 kg Linseed oil = 1,49 /kg ; price for 1 kg Linseed oil cake = 0,286/kg, according to WFLDB economic value. Price for soap stocks and deodorization condensates were approximated from the economic values of rapeseed co-products: 0,2179 /kg Linseed soap stock, 0,2179 /kg Linseed deodorisation condensates.
Including consumptions at crushing and refining
Data for crushing come from AGRIBALYSE 1.4 datateset  "Flaxseed crushing, processing/FR U", from AGRIBALYSE 1.4, based on expert informations. Data from crude Linseed oil refining are based on industrial data for 2013, representative of refining step for linseed oil in France.

activityName: Raw cow milk archetype, feed mix IT-154, at farm (WFLDB)
comment:
Dairy farm archetype IT-154 according to FAO, IDF, IFCN (2014).

IT-154 represents an average-sized farm in northern Italy (Lombardy), having Holstein cows with a milk yield of 8 810 kg milk/cow per year. The cows are kept in a free stall barn where milking is done in a parlour system. The farm operates on 72 ha of land that is very fertile and can also be used for cash crops. About 56 percent of the work on the farm is done by family members.

Allocation for milk based on mass balance (IDF 2015)
Inventory is for 1 kg raw milk, uncorrected. Mass produced is given for FPCM equivalent.

food.explain:
Cet ICV correspond à la production de l'huile d'arachide, de la culture jusqu'aux portes de l'usine. La trituration et le raffinage sont représentatifs de la production au Sénégal. Cet ICV est l'ICV majoritaire du mix de consommation d'huile d'arachide en France. Le transport des arachides est inclus mais le transport aval de l'huile d'arachide n'est pas inclus dans cet ICV. 
Selon le mix de consommation français de l'huile d'arachide, l'origine par défaut devrait être Hors Europe. 
La densité de l'huile d'arachide est de 0,915. 
Comme le précise la méthodologie AGRIBALYSE, il n'y a pas de transport frigorifique pour les huiles végétales.

comment:
Data based on Bevilacqua 2007. Durum wheat semolina production in a mill producing 68'000 tonnes semolina/year. 
9 tonnes durum wheat gives 6.8 tonnes semolina and 2.1 tonnes co-products (mainly bran)
Included steps are: stocking (in silos), cleaning (wheat separated from extraneous materials), conditioning (water addition), grinding, sifting (classification: gives 76% semolina, 24% subproducts). Subproducts are used for catle feed.
Price of durum wheat semolina based on alibaba.com, accessed May 2015, 10 first price data considered: 393 EUR/tonne

Un mix d'importation de l'huile de palme brute est considéré (origines Indonésie, Thailande, Malaysie et transport jusqu'en europe inclus). L'étape de raffinage de l'huile de palme est représentative du raffinage Européen. Le transport en aval de l'huile de palme raffinée n'est pas inclus dans cet ICV. 
Cet ICV est appelé dans des ICV de produits alimentaires de la base Agribalyse tels que margarines, bouillon, muesli...
L'origine par défaut devrait être Europe car le transport en amont du raffinage (ayant lieu en Europe) est déjà comptabilisé. 
La densité de l'huile de palme est de 0,895. 
Comme le précise la méthodologie AGRIBALYSE, il n'y a pas de transport frigorifique pour les huiles végétales
